text: Despite the potential fitness cost of increased glycosylation sites, their presence has been shown to compensate for the fitness costs associated with other antibody escape mutations [184] . Compositionally, although the total number of glycans present on HAs is significantly less than on HIV-1 Env, glycosylation analyses has revealed the abundance of oligomannose-type glycans at specific sites [143, 185, 186] , indicating a restriction in glycan processing in potential areas of higher glycan density and shielding.
